subject: Re: [junit] dependant TestCases
msgSnippet: ... What do you mean by the result ? Do you mean the TestResult object? Tests don t have results, in general. Could you explain what you want to do? J. B.
messageBody:
>So said machinbiduletruc2003 on 2003-05-22 --------------------
>Hi all,
>
>I use Junit and HttpUnit to test a web application based on Servlet
>I wrote 2 TestCases for each servlet.
>Those servlet are returning back some xml stream with some info
>inside.
>I would like to do the following
>- Run a TestCase #1
>- Get the result from TestCase #1
>- Run TestCase #2 using the result of TestCase #1

What do you mean by "the result"? Do you mean the TestResult object?

Tests don't have results, in general.

Could you explain what you want to do?


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
